required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Comparing Efficacy and Safety of Exubera® and Humalog®
clinical_study.official_title: A 52-Week Multicenter, Open-Label, Randomized, Parallel, Two - Arm Study Comparing Exubera® (Inhaled Human Insulin) Vs. Humalog® (Insulin Lispro), Both In Combination With Insulin Glargine In Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: To compare efficacy and safety of Exubera® vs Humalog in patients with type 1 diabetes mellitus

detailed_description.textblock: Pfizer announced in October 2007 that it would stop marketing Exubera®. At that time recruitment for study, A2171035 was placed on hold. Nektar, the company from which Pfizer licensed Exubera®, announced on April 9, 2008 that it had stopped its search for a new marketing partner. Accordingly, there will be no commercial availability of Exubera®. As a result, study A2171035 was terminated on May 12, 2008. Neither safety nor efficacy reasons were the cause of the study termination.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) Percent (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Attained HbA1c Levels of <8%, <7%, <6.5%, and >=8%
Percentage of Subjects With Absolute Reduction in HbA1c Levels From Baseline of >0.5%, >0.7% and >1.0%
Percentage of Subjects Who Attained Target Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) Values (4.0 to 6.5 mmol/l; 72 to 117 mg/dl) From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At weeks 2, 4, 6, 12, 24, 36, and 52 or last observation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Blood Glucose Based on Glucometer Data and In-hospital Assessments
Change From Baseline in Post-prandial Blood Glucose Based on Glucometer Data and In-hospital Assessments
Change From Baseline in Insulin Antibody Levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At weeks 24 and 52 or last observation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At weeks 12, 24, 36, and 52 or last observation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At weeks 12, 24, 36, and 52 or last observation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Basal Insulin Doses
Change From Baseline in Prandial Insulin Doses
Blood Glucose Values From Baseline Determined by Home-monitored Blood Glucose (Subject Recorded Worksheet Values)
Change in Fasting Lipids From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At weeks 24 and 52 or last observation

intervention.description: Preprandial inhaled insulin regimen and administration of insulin glargine QD
Subcutaneous insulin regimen of pre-prandial insulin lispro and administration of insulin glargine QD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus Type 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe Asthma, severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
- Smoking

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 340 subjects were planned to be randomized; 87 were screened and 58 were randomized to study treatment prior to study termination.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: As a result of Pfizer's decision (18Oct2007) to return the worldwide rights for Exubera ® (insulin human [rDNA origin]) Inhalation Powder) to Nektar, from which Pfizer licensed inhaled insulin technology, it was decided to terminate this study.

group.title: Exubera ®
group.description: Preprandial inhaled insulin regimen plus once daily (QD) administration of insulin glargine.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin regimen of pre-prandial insulin lispro and QD administration of insulin glargine.

group.title: Exubera ®
group.description: Preprandial inhaled insulin regimen plus once daily (QD) administration of insulin glargine.

group.title: Insulin Lispro
group.description: Subcutaneous (SC) insulin regimen of pre-prandial insulin lispro and QD administration of insulin glargine.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) Percent (%)
outcome.description: As a result of Pfizer's decision (18Oct2007) to return the worldwide rights for Exubera ® (insulin human [rDNA origin]) Inhalation Powder) to Nektar, from which Pfizer licensed inhaled insulin technology, it was decided to terminate this study. No efficacy data were summarized due to limited enrollment/early termination.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) population. Due to low number of subjects that completed, no descriptive statistics for the efficacy endpoints are provided.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of <60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), <12 mo from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: As a result of Pfizer’s decision to stop marketing Exubera ®, this study was terminated. Due to the early termination of the study and the low number of subjects who completed, no descriptive statistics for efficacy endpoints are provided.
